      • isEmpty

        public final boolean isEmpty()
        Returns:
        true if, and only if one ore more non-missing values were recorded in the sequence.

      • max

        public final double max()
                 throws java.lang.ArithmeticException
        Returns:
        the largest value of the elements in the sequence
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArithmeticException - in case this function was called prior to recording any elements in the sequence

      • mean

        public final double mean()
                  throws java.lang.ArithmeticException
        Returns:
        the average value of the elements in the sequence
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArithmeticException - in case this function was called prior to recording any elements in the sequence

      • min

        public final double min()
                 throws java.lang.ArithmeticException
        Returns:
        the smallest value of the elements in the sequence
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArithmeticException - in case this function was called prior to recording any elements in the sequence

      • missing

        public final int missing()
        Returns:
        a non-negative integer, giving the number of ''missing'' elements in the sequence

      • n

        public final int n()
        Provides the number of elements in this instance.
        Returns:
        a non-negative integer, giving the number of elements in the sequence

      • relativeError

        public final double relativeError()
        Returns:
        the relative error of the elements in the sequence, defined as the standard deviation divided by the mean.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArithmeticException - in case this function was called prior to recording any elements in the sequence

      • sd

        public final double sd()
        Returns:
        the standard deviation of the elements in the sequence
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArithmeticException - in case this function was called prior to recording any elements in the sequence

      • sum

        public final double sum()
        Returns:
        the sum of all values in the sequence

      • sum2

        public double sum2()
        Returns:
        the sum of squares of all values in the sequence

      • v

        public final double v()
        Returns:
        the sample variance f the elements in the sequence
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArithmeticException - in case this function was called prior to recording any elements in the sequence

      • variance

        public double variance()

      • ν

        public final int ν()
        Provides the degrees of freedom offered by this instance.
        Returns:
        a non-negative integer, giving the degree of freedom in the sequence, i.e., the number of elements - 1.
        See Also:
        n()
